Do you need to see a part of your data after loading it? You can use `head()` or `tail()` to view the first or last rows. The default row count is 6.

![](images/head1.png)

More info here: <https://stat.ethz.ch/R-manual/R-devel/library/utils/html/head.html>

Do you need more statistics about your dataset? Check out `skimr::skim()`, a great recommend from Laura Mudge

![](images/head2.png) ![](images/head3.png)

<https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/skimr/vignettes/skimr.html>

Update 6/5/23: `dplyr::slice_head()` and `dplyr::slice_tail()`, and other `dplyr::slice_` functions provide more functionality.
